trans-unit.source: Provides services for editing control templates at design time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingService> interface is obsolete.
Expose templates through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property of a control designer.
The design host creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion> for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> defined for a control designer.
Creates a new template editing frame for the specified templated control designer, using the specified name and templates.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingService> interface is obsolete.
Expose templates through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property of a control designer.
The design host creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion> for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> defined for a control designer.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner"></xref> that will use the template editing frame.
The name of the editing frame that will be displayed on the frame.

Typically this is the same as the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb.Text"></xref> property used as the menu text for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb"></xref> that is invoked to create the frame.
An array of names for the templates that the template editing frame will contain.
The new <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref>.

Creates a new template editing frame for the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner"></xref>, using the specified name, template names, control style, and template styles.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingService> interface is obsolete.
Expose templates through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property of a control designer.
The design host creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion> for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> defined for a control designer.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedControlDesigner"></xref> that will use the template editing frame.
The name of the editing frame that will be displayed on the frame.

Typically this is the same as the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb.Text"></xref> property used as the menu text for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateEditingVerb"></xref> that is invoked to create the frame.
An array of names for the templates that the template editing frame will contain.
The control <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> for the editing frame.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that represents the template styles for the editing frame.
The new <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingFrame"></xref>.
Gets the name of the parent template.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingService> interface is obsolete.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion.TemplateDefinition%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion> class for equivalent design time functionality.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control"></xref> for which to get the name of the parent template.
The name of the parent template.
Gets a value that indicates whether the service supports nested template editing.
This property indicates whether a template editor can be invoked from a component of a parent template editor's templated control.
This is called nested template editing, because a template editor is invoked for a component of a control for which a template editor is already operating.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ITemplateEditingService> interface is obsolete.
Expose templates through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property of a control designer.
The design host creates a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplatedEditableDesignerRegion> for each <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> defined for a control designer.
`true` if the service supports nested template editing; otherwise, `false`.
